title: nf-core/proteinfamilies pipeline parameters
description: Generate protein family level models (Multiple Sequence Alignments (MSAs), Hidden Markov Models (HMMs)) starting from a FASTA amino acid sequence file.

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file '.csv' containing information about the samples in the experiment.
input.help_text: You will need to create a design file with information about the samples in your experiment before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file '.csv' with 3 columns, and a header row. See [usage docs](https://nf-co.re/proteinfamilies/usage#samplesheet-input).

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.
outdir.help_text: You will need to define where your results will be saved. Use this parameter to specify the location.

email.description: Email address for completion summary. Example: name.surname@example.com
email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

multiqc_title.description: MultiQC report title. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails. Example: name.surname@example.com
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

max_multiqc_email_size.description: File size limit when attaching MultiQC reports to summary emails. Example: name.surname@example.com

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

hook_url.description: Incoming hook URL for messaging service
hook_url.help_text: Incoming hook URL for messaging service. Currently, MS Teams and Slack are supported.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

multiqc_logo.description: Custom logo file to supply to MultiQC. File name must also be set in the MultiQC config file

multiqc_methods_description.description: Custom MultiQC yaml file containing HTML including a methods description.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

pipelines_testdata_base_path.description: Base URL or local path to location of pipeline test dataset files

trace_report_suffix.description: Suffix to add to the trace report filename. Default is the date and time in the format yyyy-MM-dd_HH-mm-ss.

clustering_params.title: Clustering parameters
clustering_params.description: Use these parameters to control the flow of the clustering subworkflow execution.

save_mmseqs_db.description: Save the db output folder of mmseqs createdb
save_mmseqs_db.help_text: Specify to save the mmseqs formatted database of input fasta sequences.

clustering_tool.description: Choose clustering algorithm. Either simple 'cluster' for medium size inputs, or 'linclust' for less sensitive clustering of larger datasets.

cluster_seq_identity.description: mmseqs parameter for minimum sequence identity
cluster_seq_identity.help_text: Minimum sequence identity required for clustering. The mmseqs default is 0.9, but protein families contain way more diverse sequences (https://doi.org/10.1093/protein/12.2.85).

cluster_coverage.description: mmseqs parameter for minimum sequence coverage ratio
cluster_coverage.help_text: Minimum sequence length coverage required for clustering

cluster_cov_mode.description: mmseqs parameter for coverage mode: 0 for both, 1 for target and 2 for query sequence
cluster_cov_mode.help_text: Defined by the number of aligned residue pairs divided by 0: the maximum of the length of query/centre and target/non-centre sequences, 1: the length of the target/non-centre sequence, 2: the length of the query/centre

save_mmseqs_clustering.description: Save the clustering output folder of mmseqs cluster or linclust
save_mmseqs_clustering.help_text: Specify to save the mmseqs formatted result clustering.

cluster_size_threshold.description: Minimum clustering chunk size threshold to create seed Multiple Sequence Alignments upon.
cluster_size_threshold.help_text: This is an initial filter for the mmseqs clustering results. The lower the threshold, the more families will be generated. Additional sequences may be later recruited in the families.

alignment_params.title: Alignment parameters
alignment_params.description: Use these parameters to control the Multiple Sequence Alignment subworkflow execution.

alignment_tool.description: Choose alignment tool. FAMSA is recommended as best time-memory-accuracy combination option.

trim_msa.description: Boolean whether to trim the Multiple Sequence Alignment (MSA) gaps

clipkit_out_format.description: Choose the output format of the clipped alignment.
clipkit_out_format.help_text: The default value offered by the tool is `clipkit`, but the user can overwrite by changing this variable (e.g., msa, aln, fas, etc.)

trim_ends_only.description: Choose if ClipKIT should only clip gaps at the ends of the MSAs.
trim_ends_only.help_text: By default, ClipKIT clips gaps over the specified threshold, both at the ends and throughout the length of the MSA. This flag restricts clipping to the ends

gap_threshold.description: Multiple Sequence Alignment (MSA) positions with gappiness greater than this threshold will be trimmed

recruit_sequences_with_models.description: Set to true to recruit additional sequences from the input FASTA file using the family Hidden Markov Models (HMMs) to refine the alignments
recruit_sequences_with_models.help_text: If this is set to true, the hmmer/hmmsearch module will be used to recruit additional sequences from the input fasta file into the family (above the hmmsearch_query_length_threshold), resulting in bigger but better described families

hmmsearch_write_target.description: Boolean whether to generate target results file of hmmsearch
hmmsearch_write_target.help_text: Specify to calculate the hmmsearch tabular (space-delimited) summary of per-target output (*.tbl.gz).

hmmsearch_write_domain.description: Boolean whether to generate domain results file of hmmsearch
hmmsearch_write_domain.help_text: Specify to calculate the hmmsearch tabular (space-delimited) summary of per-domain output (*.domtbl.gz).

hmmsearch_evalue_cutoff.description: hmmsearch e-value cutoff threshold for reported results

save_hmmsearch_results.description: Save the output of hmmsearch (.domtbl.gz and .tbl.gz)
save_hmmsearch_results.help_text: Specify to save the .domtbl.gz and .tbl.gz files generated by running hmmsearch on the family model against the input set of sequences.

hmmsearch_query_length_threshold.description: hmmsearch minimum length percentage filter of hit env vs query length
hmmsearch_query_length_threshold.help_text: This length threshold should be quite high to make sure that small, fragmented sequences are not recruited in the family models

redundancy_params.title: Redundancy removal parameters
redundancy_params.description: Use these parameters to control the redundancy removal subworkflow execution.

remove_family_redundancy.description: Removal of between-family redundancy via hmmsearch.
remove_family_redundancy.help_text: Similar families should not be further processed, for better resource management and to avoid duplication of families.

hmmsearch_family_length_threshold.description: hmmsearch minimum length percentage filter of hit env vs query length, for redundant family removal

remove_sequence_redundancy.description: Removal of inside-family redundancy of sequences via mmseqs clustering.
remove_sequence_redundancy.help_text: Highly similar sequences within the same family should be removed, while making sure that the protein family diversity is still well captured.

cluster_seq_identity_for_redundancy.description: mmseqs parameter for minimum sequence identity
cluster_seq_identity_for_redundancy.help_text: Need to be quite high, to make sure that the diversity is still well captured, well highly similar sequences are removed

cluster_coverage_for_redundancy.description: mmseqs parameter for minimum sequence coverage ratio
cluster_coverage_for_redundancy.help_text: Need to be quite high, to make sure that the diversity is still well captured, well highly similar sequences are removed

cluster_cov_mode_for_redundancy.description: mmseqs parameter for coverage mode: 0 for both, 1 for target and 2 for query sequence
cluster_cov_mode_for_redundancy.help_text: Defined by the number of aligned residue pairs divided by 0: the maximum of the length of query/centre and target/non-centre sequences, 1: the length of the target/non-centre sequence, 2: the length of the query/centre
